|brand = Buffalo |model = AirStation WMR-433 |submodelappend = <!-- yes, for space --> |submodel = <!-- SubModel number, Leave blank for unknown --> |revision = BK |subrevision = <!-- Model Subrevision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |model_part_num = |page_start_date = |page_start_origon = |wlclass = AC600 |series = <!-- Device series --> |type = travel router, access point |sernum = <!-- First 4 or so for easy version identification --> |fcc_id = FDI000000024 |icid = 6102A-059 |us_id = <!-- US ID number --> |boardid = <!-- Board Identification, Leave blank for none --> |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id -->
|cpu1chip1 = Realtek;RTL8881AM;RTL8881AM, D7M55P2, GD36 TAIWAN; |cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = Lexra |cpu1_type_rev = RLX5281 |cpu1spd = <!-- 520 MHz --> |is_doc = |bus = <!-- 8-bit, 16-bit, 32-bit, 64-bit, Leave blank for none -->
|flash1type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),NAND,Compact Flash --> |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = Macronix;; |flash1size = 2 |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4 --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 8 |ram1chip = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |ram1_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips --> |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->
|eth_cpu = true |lan_ports = 1 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = <!-- auto --> |auto_mdix = <!-- mdix support --> |sup_jumbo = <!-- Jumbo frames support --> |ethoui = DC:FB:02 |oui = DC:FB:02
|bootwait = <!-- On or Off, Leave blank for unknown --> |stockbootloader = <!-- Name;Version;Distro --> |stockos = <!-- Name;Version;Distro -->
|exp_if_types = <!-- Expansion Interface types, Leave blank for none -->
|pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 5 |pwr_amp_dc = 0.5 |pwr_conn = USB Female Micro-B
|serial = <!-- Full Serial info --> |jtag = <!-- Full JTAG info -->
|specialfeat = <!-- Features that don't fit any place else, Leave blank for none --> |flags = <!-- flags, Leave blank for none --> |addchip = 2.4/5GHz Front End Module;Anadigics;AWL9581;9581, 39520, AM CH, 1403;1; |802dot11_protocols = abgn+ac
|defaulip = 192.168.13.1 |defaultlogin = admin |defaultpass = ''randomly generated'' |defaultssid = Buffalo-A-XXXX, Buffalo-G-XXXX |defaultssid_regex = ^Buffalo-A-[A-Fa-f0-9]{4}$,,, ^Buffalo-G-[A-Fa-f0-9]{4}$, |default_ch = <!-- Defaults channel(s) Radio(s) are set to --> |manuf = Gemtek |manuf_model = WRTT-305ACN |manuf_rev = V00 |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = <!-- Third party firmware official support, AsusWRT-Merlin, CeroWrt, DD-WRT, DD-WRT (kong), DD-WRT (kongac), DD-WRT (kongarm), FreedomBox, FreshTomato-ARM, Gargoyle, LibreWrt, Oleg (wl500g), Oleg-ng (wl500g), OpenWrt, Tomato, Tomato RAF, Tomato (shibby), Tomato (Toastman), TomatoUSB, Wive-NG -->
|availability = common |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = 04/22/2014 |estreldate = <!-- Estimated release date --> |estprice = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = 747464129563 |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = N82E16833162090 |asin = B00KUB48KW |asin_country = US |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = China
|buttons = <!-- buttons available --> |led = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimensions = 45 mm x 45 mm x 15 mm |weight = 19 g
|wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1cpu = true |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |rad1txchains = 1 |rad1rxchains = 1 |rad1sstreams = 1 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n/ac |rad1ac = 433 |nqam1 = <!-- 600, 750, 900, 1000 --> |rad1n = 150/150 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1a = 54 |rad1freq = 2.4 or 5
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "WRTT-305ACN_V00", "ESK-H09-8100R RoHS", and a date code :of '''1403''' is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. Like other RTL8881xx SoCs, this device is using the 8 MiB RAM integrated :into the SoC. The Flash may be rather low (<= 4 MiB, possibly 2 MiB).
Per the FCC EUT's MAC label, a DC:FB:02 OUI is presumed :to be used by at least some devices.
===Additional specs, per the FCC manual=== *11ac connectivity for transfer speeds up to 433Mbps *11n support with speeds up to 150Mbps *Dimensions: 45 mm x 45 mm x 15 mm *Weight: 19 g
==See also== *[[Buffalo AirStation WSR-600DHP]] *[[Buffalo AirStation WSR-1166DHP]]
[[Category:English Documentation]]
